Spurs edge Celts

A late Celtics surge made it a close one, but Paul Pierce missed the game-winning jumper as the Celtics fell to the Spurs, 87-86 tonight in Boston.

Mass. approves NStar, Northeast Utilities merger

The nearly $20 billion deal will create New England's largest utility and likely give the company influence over energy and environmental policies. (Boston Globe)

T board votes for fare hikes, service cuts

By a 4-1 vote , the MBTA board agreed to raise subway fares by 30 cents, bus rides by 25 cents, and commuter rail fares at least $1.25, starting July 1. (Boston Globe)
  • Discuss the vote  |  Review the controversy over T fares
  • Video  |  Pictures Expected MBTA service changes

Anti-gay marriage law discriminates against Mass. couples, lawyers argue

Lawyers representing 17 plaintiffs urged a court panel to strike down a federal law that defines marriage as a union only of a man and a woman. (Boston Globe)

unneeded, say doctors groups
